result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C Krizek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph C Krizek in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 14CM-546 and 15CM-208.

2:06 PM Court calls cases.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 and 2 and 3 in 14CM-546. Counts 4-9 would be dismissed and read in.
15CM-208 will be dismissed and read in.

Defendant has been accepted into the VIP Program. 
State recommends the VIP Program for 9 months with conditions.
Upon successful completion of the program, Count 1 and Count 2 will be amended to an ordinance violation and Count 3 will be dismissed.

Atty Drengler states that restitution will be paid in full shortly.

Atty Drengler concurs.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
State files a restitution summary to the Court.

Defendant concurs.
Generally the Court would like restitution paid before continuing.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 1 14CM-546
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2 14CM-546
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3 14CM-546

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of Judgment of Conviction this date on the three counts.
14CM-546: Count 1: Criminal Damage to Property
14CM-546: Count 2: Criminal Damage to Property
14CM-546: Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property
14CM-546: Count 4 through Count 9: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-208: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Restitution is to be paid, to the DA's office, by August 18, 2015, provided that payment is made, Court places Defendant in the VIP program for a period of 9 months with the conditions that have been outlined in the assessment.  25 hours community service, AODA and comply, absolute sobriety,   do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription, do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances, maintain full-time employment, full-time schooling or a combination of both for full-time, comply with conditions as stated by the case manager, write letter of apology to each victim in the case. If successful, Court will amend Count 1 and Count 2 to ordinances of disorderly conduct and Count 3 will be dismissed and read in

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph C Krizek
Current: 1920 Hillside Dr, Reedsville, WI 54230 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2015)
Prior: 1920 Hillside Dr 207, Reedsville, WI 54230
Comply with any non-monetary conditions that are currently in effect in any of his currently pending cases.

Defendant Joseph C Krizek in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court accepts the authorization in the file. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.
Atty Knaapen recommends conditions for bond. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
